result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald J. Badtke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald J. Badtke

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 10:18 a.m. Defendant Ronald J. Badtke in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant previously requested counsel. Defendant states that he cannot afford an attorney. DE wishes to speak with the DA. The parties have reached a resolution.   Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: Ct 1 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 2 - DRI. No statement by DE. Court orders: Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.
Status conference on February 3, 2015 at 10:15 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:08 p.m. Defendant Ronald J. Badtke in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will not be represented by SPD if released from custody. Defendant requests court appointed counsel which the court will not allow as the defendant is earning too much. Defendant will privately retain counsel if he wishes to have one. DA Blader requesting $500 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Patzer. NGP entered. Court orders $500 Sig Bond.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 10:15 am.
